purpose.para: This stylesheet uses WordML to produce DTBook

description.para: Initial issue with DMFC in mind

remark.para: No bold or italic other than characterstyles
Tables don't come out right if they include rowspanning

description.para: Externalized tag set definitions and created an XML schema for them.
Added attribute "merge" to wrap element (tag set definitions). The effect is that all consecutive paras using the same style will be included in the same outer element.
Added element "attribute" to wrap element (tag set definitions).
Added support for rowspan in tables
Added page-attribute: normal (for arabic numerals), front (for roman numerals), special (otherwise)
Added meta-elements containing info on this conversion (version and date)
Removed imggroup element from image rule (this can be added through a paragraph style).
Removed unused constructs from the schema
Changed the class-attribute for the first level1 to colophon. Added class="chapter" to all other level1
Made processing more general in several places
Added frontmatter. Now, everything preceding the first heading will become part of frontmatter.
Externalized revision history and generated a schema definition for it.
Modularized the stylesheet according to task.
Changed the name of some input parameters and added one called "stylesheet". This one sets the assigned stylesheet in the output, or none if '' is specified. The default value is 'dtbook2xhtml.xsl'
Added param for using original extension for image files.
Changed the pattern for @id on pagenum to "page-[no]"
If no headings exist in the document, the text is now inserted into bodymatter instead of frontmatter.
If a heading is not followed by either sub-sections or paragraphs, an empty paragraph is inserted.
Headers and footers have been removed from the processing flow, because they caused p in p (and are irrelevant to the flow of the text).
Changed processing of wx:sect as not to generate multiple bodymatter.
Changed default value of the stylesheet parameter to ''

remark.para: A footnote reference that has been explicitly labelled in Word, will appear twice in DTBook.
Mixing several different list styles consecutively in Word may generate duplicate list items if at least one of them have been defined in the customization files.

Inline elements are sometimes rendered as several consecutive elements, e.g. word. The extent of this problem depends on the fragmentation of the original file. It can be mended somewhat by unchecking the "Store random number to improve merge accuracy" box under "Privacy options" in the Options pane in Word before authoring the document.
